What we talk about when we...

Talk About Want

Below you will find short summaries of the anonymous letters in Want, the collection edited by Gillian Anderson, organized and ordered as in the original.

These summaries were created using AI, specifically the large language model Claude 3.7 Sonnet from Anthropic. The prompt used appears after the list—you can skip to it here.

Though created on a whim, this collection may be valuable for book clubs and other groups reading Want together. It provides a quick way to review and reference the letters, potentially enhancing your discussions.

You can find out more about Want from its publisher, Bloomsbury Publishing, on its website. Please consider purchasing a copy from your local independent bookstore.

Letters

  1. On Fantasies
  2. Rough and Ready
  3. To Be Worshipped
  4. Off Limits
  5. The Captive
  6. Kink
  7. Strangers
  8. Power and Submission
  9. Exploration
  10. More, More, More
  11. The Watchers and the Watched
  12. I Always Have A Thing For...
  13. Gently, Gently

On Fantasies

1. 14. To Be Worshipped

1. I crave someone who worships me with carnal obsession, who deeply desires every part of me.
2. My fantasy is to be completely worshipped, to be the center of my own story again – not just sexually desired but deeply seen, adored, and respected despite my ordinary humanness – escaping the impossible standards and demands of modern womanhood where I'm constantly pulled in different directions and made to feel I'm never enough.

Off Limits

1. I fantasize about my best friend constantly, touching her and fucking her in my mind throughout my everyday life.
2. I secretly fantasize about intimate encounters with women - kissing them, experiencing their scent, and everything that could follow - though these fantasies always involve unattainable figures like actresses or fictional characters, not women I know personally.
